``````````customizeTheme
        <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAQAAAC1+jfqAAAABGdBTUEAALGPC/xhBQAAAAFzUkdCAK7OHOkAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAAArSURBVCjPY2CgFviPBHEoQFZKQAEDNiX/0Vj/8VuBxS3/8Zg5lBRgQioBAHb3KtYfBvSUAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
        <title></title>
        <style>
            img[src='#-banner-']{content:url(data:image/jpeg;base64,)}
            @media(min-width: 32rem) {
                div#content > p:first-child > img[src*='-banner-'],
                div#content > p:first-child > a > img[src*='-banner-'] {
                    border-bottom-color:#4872ae; 
                }
                div#content > p:first-child + h1:first-of-type,
                div#content > p:first-child + h2:first-of-type,
                div#content > p:first-child + h1:first-of-type strong,
                div#content > p:first-child + h2:first-of-type strong {
                    color:white;
                }
            }
        </style>
``````````

``````````customizePage
            img[src^='#-test1-']{content:url(data:image/jpeg;base64,)}
``````````

![md-embed](#-banner- "md-embed")
# **md-embed**

## Usage
1. Write [Github Flavored](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax) [Markdown](https://commonmark.org/help/) content in a text file with the extension `.md`
1. `./md-embed input.md [output-directory]`  Creates `input.md.html` and `input.html` in the output directory.
2. Choose one of the following:
    1. Publish `input.md.html`.  The markdown is embedded in the html file and is formatted by Javascript running in the browser.
    1. If no mermaid diagrams are used, publish `input.html`.  It has fewer dependencies than `input.md.html`. 
    1. Use the browser to extract the generated content from `input.md.html` and put it in `input.html`:
        1. Open `input.md.html` in the browser.  Right click on the document and choose Inspect.
        1. Right click the html element, choose Copy -> Copy OuterHTML
        1. Open `input.html` in  your text editor and paste the contents, replacing all the existing content.
1. Publish `output.html`

## Add a banner at the top of the document
If the first thing in the document is an image with '-banner-' in the url followed by a top level header, the image is displayed full width,
the text is styled to overlay it, and a bottom border is added.
Specifying `#-banner-` as the image url causes it to use the default banner.
```
![md-embed](#-banner- "md-embed")
# **md-embed**
```

## Add a footer
If a document ends with a horizontal rule followed by one paragraph, style the paragraph as a footer.
```
----------
footer
```

## Style Images

#### Markdown Syntax for Images
```
![alt-text](url "optional title")
![](url)
```

#### Image Size
By default, pictures are sized to the full width of the document.
To make them smaller, append `#` to the end of the image url, and add one of the following:
* -seveneighthssize-
* -fivesixthssize-
* -threequarterssize-
* -twothirdssize-
* -fiveeighthssize-
* -halfsize-
* -thirdsize-
* -quartersize-
* -sixthsize-
* -eighthsize-

For example:
```
![](image.jpg#-sixthsize-)
```

![](#-test1-sixthsize-)

If the image is smaller than the size specified, it will be resized larger. 
To avoid, that prepend the size with 'max', e.g. `-maxhalfsize-`, `-maxthirdsize-`, etc.

#### Image Position
By default images are left aligned. To specify alignment, add `-right-`, `-left-`, `-floatright-`, `-floatleft-`
in the same way as with the size.

```
![](image.jpg#-right-)
```

Floating multiple images followed by one that is not floated aligns them across the page:
```
![](image.jpg#-thirdsize-floatleft-)
![](image.jpg#-thirdsize-floatleft-)
![](image.jpg#-thirdsize-left-)
```

![Fall in Monture, Montana](#-test1-thirdsize-floatleft-)
![Fall in Monture, Montana](#-test1-thirdsize-floatleft-)
![Fall in Monture, Montana](#-test1-thirdsize-left-)

#### Combine Images and Text

Wrap a float-positioned image and some text in the HTML tags `<div class="md-embed-group">` and `</div>`.
Note that the tags need blank lines ***before*** and ***after***. Depending on the content
being grouped, if the margins collapse, use `md-embed-padded-group` instead.

```
&lt;div class="md-embed-group"&gt;

![](image.jpg#-halfsize-floatleft-)
Some text to the right of the image

&lt;/div&gt;
```

<div class="md-embed-group">

![Fall in Monture, Montana](#-test1-eighthsize-floatleft-)
At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque 
corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in 
culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Et harum quidem rerum facilis est 
et expedita distinctio. Nam libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio cumque nihil impedit quo minus 
id quod maxime placeat facere possimus, omnis voluptas assumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus. Temporibus autem
quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et
molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus
maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat.

</div>

## Style a Sub-header

Headers normally include some space after. To suppress it, e.g. to have a subtitle immediately following,
insert a `<div class="md-embed-title"></div>` above them (with the obligatory blank lines before and after it).

```
&lt;div class="md-embed-title"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

## Hamburgefonstiv
#### February 6, 2019
```

<div class="md-embed-title"></div>

## Hamburgefonstiv
###### February 6, 2019

## Style an Inset Box

To style an inset box, place the content between `<div class="md-embed-notice type">` and `</div>`.
The first line of text becomes the caption of the box, and the remainder is the content.
The supported types are `tip` (green), `warning` (red), `info` (gold), and `note` (blue)

```
&lt;div class="md-embed-notice note"&gt;

Lorem Ipsum...

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce vehicula pharetra ultricies. Cras magna turpis,

&lt;/div&gt;
```

<div class="md-embed-notice note">

Lorem Ipsum...

![Fall in Monture, Montana](#-test1-sixthsize-floatright-)
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce vehicula pharetra ultricies. Cras magna turpis,
vestibulum ut arcu et, rutrum porta velit. Curabitur luctus erat a velit tincidunt, vel malesuada nibh tempor.
Mauris condimentum quam lorem, in finibus eros faucibus id. Nunc erat metus, fringilla dignissim faucibus id,
malesuada quis justo.
        
</div>

## Embed a Mermaid Drawing
Mermaid drawings may be embeded as code blocks, beginning and ending with three back ticks on separate lines,
with the code language `mermaid`

~~~
```mermaid
flowchart TB
    c1-->a2
    subgraph ide1 [one]
       a1-->a2
       end
```
~~~

```mermaid
flowchart TB
    c1-->a2
    subgraph ide1 [one]
       a1-->a2
       end
```

## Embed a QR Code
QR Codes may be embedded as code blocks with the language `qrcode`. QR Codes are styled as images, and support
the same `-size-` and `-position-` specifiers, after the word `qrcode`.
~~~
```qrcode-sixthsize-left-
https://www.google.com
```
~~~

```qrcode-sixthsize-left-
https://www.google.com
```

## Customize the template

A section of html may be embedded in a code section with the language 'customizeTheme',
fenced with 10 back-ticks.


    ``````````customizeTheme
    <title>md-embed</title>
    <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="">
    ``````````

#### Title
`<title>Your title here</title>`
#### Favicon
`<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="">`\
Customize the href and the type as desired.
#### Document Width
`body{max-width:64rem;}`\
`1rem` is 16 pixels, so the default width is 1024 pixels.
#### Banner
`img[src='#-banner-']{content:url('file')}`\
For the default body width, use a picture with about    an 8x1 aspect ratio, e.g. 1024x128
#### Banner Border Color
`border-bottom-color:#4872ae;`
#### Banner Text Color
`color:white;`

## Add Style
You may add your own style in a code block with the language 'customizePage'

    ``````````customizePage
    ``````````

## More Examples
See the source of this document and md-embed-test.md for more examples and ideas.

## Install CSS into Visual Studio Code

`md-embed.min.css` is included in the release folder so it can be installed in Visual Studio Code under markdown.styles setting.

The styled preview is not exactly what the browser will display because Visual Studio Code doesn't style the HTML exactly the same way that marked.js does, and code blocks, mermaid diagrams, and qrcodes won't be rendered. But it's able to hide the code blocks used for customizing the theme and customizing the page.

## About md-embed

This is a really small thing.  Basically it is just packaging together a bunch of good stuff and using it as intended.
* [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/), [CommonMark](https://spec.commonmark.org/), [GFM](https://github.github.com/gfm/)
* [Marked](https://marked.js.org/)
* [DOMPurify](https://github.com/cure53/DOMPurify)
* [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/)
* [Mermaid](https://mermaid.js.org/)
* [node-qrcode](https://github.com/soldair/node-qrcode)
* [JSDelivr](https://www.jsdelivr.com/)

Using minimal tools:
* [terser](https://www.npmjs.com/package/terser)
* [uglifycss](https://www.npmjs.com/package/uglifycss)
* [gawk](https://www.gnu.org/software/gawk/manual/gawk.html)
* [chromium](https://www.chromium.org/chromium-projects/)
* [mozjpeg](https://github.com/mozilla/mozjpeg)
* [base64](https://linux.die.net/man/1/base64)

The pictures are both from an air quality camera in Monture, Montana, 
which was provided at the time by a now-defunct US government program.  

Goals:
* Single-file Markdown authoring
* Able to view locally without a server
* Able to customize style
